content:
Hi Sam,

It sounds like there may be an issue with the POP account syncing properly after import. Here are a few things you can check:

Verify POP Settings – Make sure your Gmail account is set to allow POP access in Gmail settings (under Forwarding and POP/IMAP). Check Account Configuration – Go to Account Settings in TB and ensure the POP server settings are correct: Incoming server: pop.gmail.com Port: 995 Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication: OAuth2 (preferred) or Normal Password Manually Download Messages – Try selecting Get Messages or restarting TB to trigger a download. Check for Duplicate Profiles – If you've imported multiple times, there might be duplicate configurations causing conflicts. Try Adding the Account Manually – Instead of importing, try setting up the Gmail POP account manually in TB. If the issue persists, you might also check TB logs (Tools > Activity Manager) for any errors. Let me know how it goes!

Best, Colin Munro

Do you use POP recent mode or POP normal mode? If you want to use Gmail POP on multiple devices, Google recommends using POP recent mode instead of POP normal mode.

The following links might be helpful: 1. How does Gmail POP work? https://support.google.com/a/answer/6089246 2. Read Gmail messages on other email clients using POP https://support.google.com/mail/answer/7104828

Quotation:

Gmail users can use either POP normal mode or recent mode to sync their mail. If you're syncing your mail to one mail client, you should use normal mode. If you're syncing mail to a few different mail clients, then you should use recent mode.
